Yes, Saiga antelopes use their long nose for various other reasons beyond filtering air, these include:

1. Attracting mates: During the mating season, male saiga antelopes will use their nose to attract females by making a distinct grunting noise, which is amplified by the large nasal cavity.

2. Digging for food and water: Saiga antelopes will often use their nose to dig into the ground to access food and water.

3. Regulating body temperature: The nose of the Saiga antelope helps to regulate their body temperature. When the weather is cold, and the antelope needs to conserve heat, the nose shrinks to reduce the amount of heat lost through the respiratory system. Conversely, when temperatures are hot, the nose increases blood flow to dissipate heat and regulate body temperature.

So, the long flexible nose of the Saiga antelope is an adaptation that has multiple uses than just filtering air, making it an impressive adaptation that helps the antelope survive in its environment.
